title: How to earn at least a $100 a day as an experienced freelance content writer who has zero clients - the platform I used for years cancelled my membership, which means I have lost all my reputation - Quora

response.answer_text: Now that you've discovered oDesk, or Upwork as they are now known, the way to make $100 a day is to always turn in quality work. Network with other writers, take as many tests on Upwork as you can, and post your highest quality work on your portfolio. It will take a while, but I have a friend who makes that much writing. You have to commit to it as a full time job, just as if you were going to a physical job, and it will take a lot of hard work and effort on your part. But it can be done. Just don't expect it to happen overnight.

$100? You can earn more than that a day! Stop underestimating your skills and experience, because you're 99% better than many freelance writers who work for as low as $1 per hour. If you've got good work samples already, half of your work is already done. Now head over and read this detailed in-depth guide I published on how to get recurring monthly contracts without compromising on your rates. (Without using any outsourcing platforms like Upwork, Freelancer or Guru) Do comment and feel free to ask questions regarding your problems. Best!
